content: **difficulty ** easy/intermediate **materials needed ** 2 55mm steel hook size 0 or hook needed to obtain gauge 200-250 yds loops and threads #1 fingering weight woolike in beige or color of your choice scissors yarn needle **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpsc = front post single_crochet fptr2tog = front post treble_crochet 2 together hdc2tog = half_double_crochet 2 together rs = right side ws = wrong side st/sts = stitch/stitches space/sps = space/spaces prev = previous **additional terms ** rs = right side ws = wrong side half_double_crochet puff st yo pull up a stitch 5 times pull through 10 loops on hook yo pull through final 2 loops cross st skip st double_crochet in next st cross over st just made and double_crochet in skipped st shell = 4 double_crochet in same st working in the 3rd loop of half_double_crochet look at the top of the stitch and locate the sideways v bend the stitch to look at the back and you should see another v you ll be working into the back loop of that v this is called the 3rd loop seed stitch alternate single_crochet and double_crochet stitches across the designated row or partial row then on the next row work a double_crochet stitch in the single_crochet stitch from the previous row and a single_crochet stitch in the double_crochet stitch from the previous row st/sts = stitch/stitches space/sps = space/spaces prev = previous **gauge ** 12 cross stitches in 4 3 row of cross stitches is 1 tall **measurements ** newborn 4 5 by 4 5 excluding ties 0-3 months 5 5 by 5 5 excluding ties 6 months 6 25 x 6 25 excluding ties 12-24 months 7 x 7 excluding ties **additional notes ** -the bonnet is worked flat in a t and then the bottom of the t is joined to the arms at the top by single_crochet this creates a very classic baby bonnet shape that is more well-known in the knitting world if you prefer to sew the seam instead of joining it with single_crochet you may -stitch counts are unimportant for the bottom--only your placement matters -this pattern is easily adjustable it is worked in multiples of 4 + 6 + 1 plus 1 more for the turning chain
